fragment: Jesse Pinkman asks Mike Ehrmantraut where he would go to start over.
Walter White partners with Jesse Pinkman to build a crystal meth empire.
Todd Alquist takes Jesse Pinkman to his apartment to dispose of a cleaning lady's body.
Jane Margolis dismisses Jesse Pinkman's metaphorical talk about going wherever the universe takes him.
Skinny Pete and Badger hide Jesse Pinkman's car and give him a place to sleep.
Badger Mayhew drives south in a Thunderbird to make it appear Jesse Pinkman is headed to Mexico.
Ed Galbraith refuses to help Jesse Pinkman unless he pays the full amount for his services.
Mike Ehrmantraut cautions Jesse Pinkman that starting over would make amends impossible.
Neil Kandy challenges Jesse Pinkman to a duel for his share of the cash.
Casey distracts Lou Schanzer while Jesse Pinkman hides in Todd Alquist's apartment.
Lou Schanzer reports finding an old note from Todd Alquist.
Kenny is one of Jesse Pinkman's captors and a member of the neonazi gang.
Old Joe helps Jesse Pinkman and Walter White with activities connected to their meth business.
Diane Pinkman has a strained relationship with her son, Jesse Pinkman.
Adam Pinkman has a strained relationship with his son, Jesse Pinkman.
